# Univariat statistics

## NAs

```{r}
data %>%
  summarize(across(.cols = everything(),
                   .fns = ~sum(is.na(.))/n()
                   ))
data %>%
  group_by(state) %>%
  summarize(across(.cols = everything(),
                   .fns = ~sum(is.na(.))/n()
                   ))
data %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  summarize(across(.cols = everything(),
                   .fns = ~sum(is.na(.))/n()
                   ))
data %>%
  group_by(state, year) %>%
  summarize(across(.cols = everything(),
                   .fns = ~sum(is.na(.))/n()
                   ))
```


## Numeric variables

```{r}
summarize2 <- function(x, na.rm = TRUE) {
  result <- c(
    Min = min(x, na.rm = na.rm),
    Q25 = quantile(x, probs = 0.25, na.rm = na.rm),
    Median = median(x, na.rm = na.rm),
    Q75 = quantile(x, probs = 0.75, na.rm = na.rm),
    Max = max(x, na.rm = na.rm),
    Mean = mean(x, na.rm = na.rm),
    SD = sd(x, na.rm = na.rm),
    No_of_unique_values = n_distinct(x),
    N = length(x) - sum(is.na(x)),
    No_NA = sum(is.na(x))
  )
}
```
```{r Univariate stats}
dim(data)
data %>%
  summarize(
    across(
      where(is.numeric),
      summarize2
    )
  ) %>%
  mutate(Stat = c("Min", "1st Quar", "Median", "3rd Quar", "Max", "Mean", "SD", "No of unique values", "n", "No of NA"),
         .before = No)
```
